findings.title: Hardcoded privileged address can seize ownership
findings.explanation: There is a hardcoded address check in withdraw allowing a specific address to become Owner and then withdraw all funds.
findings.fix_suggestion: Remove or restrict the hardcoded address check. Implement a proper owner-only transfer mechanism where ownership can only be transferred by the current owner through a controlled function.

findings.title: Unchecked low-level call return value
findings.explanation: The return value of adr.call.value(msg.value)(data) is not checked, so if the external call fails, the function does not revert and may lead to silent failures or lost funds.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use require to check the call result, e.g. `require(adr.call.value(msg.value)(data), "External call failed");` to ensure the transaction reverts on failure.

findings.title: Flawed reward distribution in redeem
findings.explanation: redeem() transfers the entire contract balance to Owner first, leaving zero balance for the caller. As a result, the caller never receives any reward despite meeting the eligibility requirement.
findings.fix_suggestion: Calculate the reward amount before any transfers and distribute the correct portion to the caller first, then transfer the remainder to the owner.

unmatched_predictions.title: Hardcoded privileged address can seize ownership
